Detailed Description

This class represents a specific translation of the Bible.

A Translation object is a list of verses with given long and short names that can imported from a text file, saved to and resumed from a binary buffer, directly indexed, and searched.

bool Translation::import ( const std::string &  long_name,
const std::string &  short_name,
const std::string &  filename 
)

Import a translation of a given name from a text file.

The text file for the translation must be in the following format, with each line representing one verse:

Unique ID*Book*Chapter*Verse number*Verse text

Example:

0*Genesis*1*1*In the beginning God created heaven, and earth.

1*Genesis*1*2*And the earth was void and empty, and darkness was upon the face of the deep; and the spirit of God moved over the waters.

2*Genesis*1*3*And God said: Be light made. And light was made.

Note that after an import, a translation is not ready to be used. It must be saved to and resumed from a binary file first.

00220     {

00222         boost::algorithm::split(parts, line, boost::algorithm::is_any_of("*"));

00225                                                  boost::lexical_cast<int>(parts[3]), parts[4],
00226                                                  boost::lexical_cast<int>(parts[0])));
00227         m_verses.push_back(verse);
00228     }
00229 
00230     return true;
00231 }

void Translation::search ( boost::shared_ptr< ISearchResults >  query,
int  search_option 
) const

Iterate the verses in this translation and add the ones which match the query to the query object.

00017 {
00018     boost::shared_ptr<VerseMatcher> verse_matcher;
00019     if ((search_option & CaseInsensitive) == CaseInsensitive)
00020     {
00021         if ((search_option & MatchWholeWord) == MatchWholeWord)
00022         {
00023             verse_matcher = boost::shared_ptr<VerseMatcher>(new CaseInsensitiveWholeWordVerseMatcher);
00024         }
00025         else
00026         {
00027             verse_matcher = boost::shared_ptr<VerseMatcher>(new CaseInsensitiveVerseMatcher);
00028         }
00029     }
00030     else
00031     {
00032         if ((search_option & MatchWholeWord) == MatchWholeWord)
00033         {
00034             verse_matcher = boost::shared_ptr<VerseMatcher>(new CaseSensitiveWholeWordVerseMatcher);
00035         }
00036         else
00037         {
00038             verse_matcher = boost::shared_ptr<VerseMatcher>(new CaseSensitiveVerseMatcher);
00039         }
00040     }
00041 
00042     SearchStringParser parser;
00043     std::vector<std::string> search_terms = parser.parse(query->get_search_string());
00044 
00045     std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator search_term = search_terms.begin();
00046 
00047     // Prime the matching verses vector by searching for the first term in the entire translation.
00048     std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<const Verse> >::const_iterator begin = m_verses.begin();
00049     std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<const Verse> >::const_iterator end = m_verses.end();
00050 
00051     std::vector<int> matching_verses;
00052     for (std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<const Verse> >::const_iterator verse = begin; verse != end; ++verse)
00053     {
00054         if (verse_matcher->is_match(*verse, *search_term))
00055         {
00056             matching_verses.push_back((*verse)->get_unique_id());
00057         }
00058     }
00059 
00060 
00061     // Now search only the primed results for the rest of the search terms (if any exist).
00062     for (++search_term; search_term != search_terms.end(); ++search_term)
00063     {
00064         std::vector<int> filtered_matching_verses;
00065         for (std::vector<int>::const_iterator verse_id = matching_verses.begin(); verse_id != matching_verses.end(); ++verse_id)
00066         {
00067             if (verse_matcher->is_match(m_verses[*verse_id], *search_term))
00068             {
00069                 filtered_matching_verses.push_back(*verse_id);
00070             }
00071         }
00072 
00073         matching_verses = filtered_matching_verses;
00074     }
00075 
00076     // Finally add the verses that matched all of the terms to the results.
00077     for (std::vector<int>::const_iterator verse_id = matching_verses.begin(); verse_id != matching_verses.end(); ++verse_id)
00078     {
00079         query->add_matching_verse(m_long_name, *verse_id);
00080     }
00081 }
